abstract.text: A vector tile source.
Describes a Custom Geometry Source to be used in the style
Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.
A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form

. If specified as a string for a vector tile source, the same property is used across all its source layers. If specified as an object only specified source layers will have id overriden, others will fallback to original feature id

For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.
Default value: 0.
Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.
Default value: 22.
A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.
Default value: false.

For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading, parsing and rendering of the transient tiles and thus to improve the rendering performance, especially on low-end devices.
Default value: 0.

Minimum tile update interval in seconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests. If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.
Default value: 0.

When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.
A raster tile source.
Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps for iOS powered by vector tiles and Metal.

When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom.
Default value: 4.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.
Denotes promote-id setting for
Callback to do various operations for tile.
For example, fetching a tile or cancelling a tile request.

Minimum tile update interval in seconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests. If the given source supports loading tiles from a server, sets the minimum tile update interval. Update network requests that are more frequent than the minimum tile update interval are suppressed.
Default value: 0.
An image data source.
Options for custom geometry source.
Describes a Custom Raster Source to be used in the style.
Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.
Default value: 0.
Interface for the direct rendering into the custom raster tiles.
Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.
The encoding used by this source. Mapbox Terrain RGB is used by default

This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.
Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.
Default value: 22.
Defines a TileCacheBudgetSize, which can be set as either a megabyte or tile count limit.
Whenever tile cache goes over the defined limit
the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache
A raster array source
Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.
Default value: 0.
A vector tile source.
Options for custom raster source.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.
Default value: “xyz”.
An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec. Required if
is not provided.

For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile network requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.
Default value: 0.
CustomRasterSource tile status.
A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are
, and
. Required if
is not provided.
A GeoJSON data source.

When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.
A property to use as a feature id (for feature state). Either a property name, or an object of the form

. If specified as a string for a vector tile source, the same property is used across all its source layers. If specified as an object only specified source layers will have id overriden, others will fallback to original feature id
Captures potential values of the
property of a GeoJSONSource.
Struct of supported Source Types
Docs : https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/style-spec/sources/
Data for a specific CustomRasterSource tile.
An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order:
. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

For the tiled sources, this property sets the tile network requests delay. The given delay comes in action only during an ongoing animation or gestures. It helps to avoid loading the transient tiles from the network and thus to avoid redundant network requests. Note that tile-network-requests-delay value is superseded with tile-requests-delay property value, if both are provided.
Default value: 0.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be encoded.
A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.
Default value: false.
A RGB-encoded raster DEM source

When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom.
Default value: 4.
An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec. Required if
is not provided.
A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are

. Required if
is not provided.
Callback for changing a CustomRasterSource tile status.
